alert.note: Alert for Arlington; City of Alexandria; City of Falls Church; Fairfax (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 05 at 4:13PM EDT until July 05 at 6:30PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR WEST CENTRAL ARLINGTON AND EAST CENTRAL FAIRFAX COUNTIES AND THE NORTHWESTERN CITY OF ALEXANDRIA AND THE CITY OF FALLS CHURCH... At 413 PM EDT, local law enforcement reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Arlington... Alexandria... Annandale... Fairfax... Vienna... Falls Church... Mantua... Pimmit Hills... Oakton... Lincolnia... Merrifield... Lake Barcroft... I66 and I495 Interchange... Seven Corners... Dunn Loring... Baileys Crossroads... FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Basement flooding can occur quickly and create a life-threatening situation. If you are in a basement, or a residence below street level, move to a higher floor immediately.

area.areaDesc: Arlington; City of Alexandria; City of Falls Church; Fairfax
